Zanzibar PARADISE: Choose Your ADVENTURE

 

ZTrans is registered Local Tour Operator based in Zanzibar, situated at the heart of Stone town.

 

We aim to provide our clients, whether they are holiday or business travelers, personal, high-quality service. ZTrans puts its emphasis on the ability to appeal to a broad range of visitors with our quality travel packages and custom-made tours. Our friendly and highly qualified staff is most willing to assist you with your travel to Zanzibar and Tanzania.

 

All of our cars meet international standards so that you can feel comfortable, relaxed and enjoy your trip.

 

Our prices are affordable and and we offer different seasonal promotions and offers.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation=”” row_type=”row” use_row_as_full_screen_section=”no” type=”full_width” angled_section=”no” text_align=”left” background_image_as_pattern=”without_pattern” z_index=”” anchor=”about”][vc_column][rev_slider_vc alias=”section1″][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation=”” row_type=”row” use_row_as_full_screen_section=”no” type=”full_width” angled_section=”no” text_align=”left” background_image_as_pattern=”without_pattern” z_index=””][vc_column][rev_slider_vc alias=”video”][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation=”” row_type=”row” use_row_as_full_screen_section=”no” type=”grid” angled_section=”no” text_align=”left” background_image_as_pattern=”without_pattern” z_index=””][vc_column css=”.vc_custom_1572791594452{padding-top: 45px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1572790342929{margin-right: 8px !important;margin-left: 8px !important;}”]

VIEW ALL OUR TOURS

[/vc_column_text][/qode_elements_holder_item][qode_elements_holder_item vertical_alignment=”middle” horizontal_alignment=”center” advanced_animations=”no”]Click and see our Zanzibar tours![/qode_elements_holder_item][/qode_elements_holder][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation=”” row_type=”row” use_row_as_full_screen_section=”no” type=”grid” angled_section=”no” text_align=”left” background_image_as_pattern=”without_pattern” anchor=”history” padding_top=”60″ padding_bottom=”30″ z_index=””][vc_column]

  1. History
  2. Island
  3. Slavery
  4. Beaches
  5. Spices
  6. Stone Town
  1. [vc_column_text]

    Zanzibar has been home to humans for at least 20,000 years

    [/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”25px”][vc_column_text]

    The presence of microlithic tools attests to 20,000 years of human occupation of Zanzibar. The islands became part of the historical record of the wider world when Arab traders discovered them and used them as a base for voyages between Arabia, India, and Africa. Unguja offered a protected and defensible harbour, so although the archipelago offered few products of value, the Arabs settled at what became Zanzibar City (Stone Town) as a convenient point from which to trade with East African coastal towns. They established garrisons on the islands and built the first mosque in the Southern hemisphere.

    [/vc_column_text]

  2. [vc_column_text]

    Zanzibar consists of several islands

    [/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”25px”][vc_column_text]

    Often referred to as the “Spice Islands”, the archipelago of Zanzibar is made up of a necklace of islands that bead their way down the shore of East Africa, off the coast of Tanzania.

    There’s the main island, which has a UNESCO World Heritage Site for its capital, sister island Pemba, with its extensive clove plantations and the neighboring Mafia Archipelago, known for its majestic coral reefs and whale sharks.

    [/vc_column_text]

  3. [vc_column_text]

    Zanzibar slave market

    [/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”25px”][vc_column_text]

    The Slave Market of Stone Town has been inactive for decades, but memorials provide remembrance of the horrific acts that once took place here. Visit this site and reflect on the atrocities of the past.

    Learn about the important role slavery played in Zanzibar’s history. For nearly 1,000 years, Arab traders traveled to the interior of Africa as far as the Congo, where they purchased or kidnapped healthy young people. The slaves who didn’t perish on the long march to Africa’s eastern coast were put in dhows and transported to Zanzibar for sale.

    [/vc_column_text]

  4. [vc_column_text]

    The Island of Zanzibar boasts pristine white sand and tourist resorts

    [/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”25px”][vc_column_text]

    Zanzibar holds a mysterious charm which can be felt throughout the archipelago. If you’ve been dreaming of sipping cocktails on white sand beaches with swaying palm trees, you should be booking your ticket right now. The best beaches can be found across the island’s coastline.

    [/vc_column_text]

  5. [vc_column_text]

    Apart from tourism, Zanzibar is renowned for its spices

    [/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”25px”][vc_column_text]

    Zanzibar, mainly Pemba Island, was once the world’s leading clove producer, but annual clove sales have since plummeted by 80% since the 1970s. Explanations given for this is a fast-moving global market, international competition and a hangover from Tanzania’s failed experiment with socialism in the 1960s and ’70s, when the government controlled clove prices and exports. Zanzibar now ranks a distant third with Indonesia supplying 75% of the world’s cloves, compared to Zanzibar’s 7%.

    Zanzibar exports spices, seaweed and fine raffia. It also has a large fishing and dugout canoe production. Tourism is a major foreign currency earner.

    [/vc_column_text]

  6. [vc_column_text]

    Zanzibar City and its most historic feature is the ancient Stone Town

    [/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space height=”25px”][vc_column_text]

    The capital city, Zanzibar, is divided into two sections: Stone Town, a World Heritage site, and Ngambo. The buildings are predominantly white coral stone with a noticeable Arab architectural style. Balconies in Stone Town surround central courtyards and open-arched rooms to ensure that the interiors are always cool. The exterior doors are intricately carved and inlaid with brass.
    Narrow roads meander between buildings some over a century old, leading you to picturesque bazaars with carpenters, jewelers, hawkers, tailors and coffee sellers. Along the island’s eastern shore runs a protective reef, which is as beautiful as it is functional.

    [/vc_column_text]

[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation=”” row_type=”row” use_row_as_full_screen_section=”no” type=”full_width” angled_section=”no” text_align=”left” background_image_as_pattern=”without_pattern” anchor=”gallery” z_index=””][vc_column]
[/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation=”” row_type=”row” use_row_as_full_screen_section=”no” type=”grid” angled_section=”no” text_align=”left” background_image_as_pattern=”without_pattern” padding_bottom=”30″ z_index=”” css=”.vc_custom_1572769756762{padding-top: 35px !important;}”][vc_column width=”1/4″][/vc_column][vc_column width=”1/2″]

  • We used Bilal car service to visit 4 different parts of the island and we could not be any happier to have chosen ZTrans services. The costs of the trips were the cheapest that we could find. The cars are new and they do have also WiFi. On top of that Bilal and his staff are very friendly and welcoming.

    - Fracu75

  • We traveled from Stone Town to Paje. Ali was very friendly and we really appreciated him as a driver. Nice car, safe driving and affordable price. Highly recommended.

    - Matthijs W

  • Highly professional company with good prices and super reliable. I would always use Bilal and Ztrans if I visited Zanzibar again. Thanks Bilal!

    - Jonny P

  • Thank you Bilal. Seamless first class service. Nice speaking with you on the way back to the airport too, interesting to learn about the piggy banks!

    - Osiolku

  • Our driver Ali was a very charming person. While we were driving to the hotel, he explained about island history and the things that we saw on our way.

    - SGruper

  • My boyfriend and I used ZTrans on several occasion during our holiday, and we definitely recommend it to all Zanzibar visitors. They are always available on WhatsApp, professional and on time. Cars are clean, spacious and drivers are also really nice (all of them spoke English). Prices are the best you could get. We do strongly recommend their service!

    - L8u7
